page.title: 18Interesting People
page.content: {Miss W.Holmes}has lived in Alsager all her life. In 1918, aged 5yrs. she went to the infants school on Bank Corner, transferring to Christchurch School at 8 years. Everyone walked to school. The school bell could be heard for miles. Boys wore celluloid collars, the girls pinafores, black woollen stocking for winter warmth and farm boys wore clogs. Playing marbles, whip and top and skipping in the road was usual as traffic was rare. Boys were absent in October potato-picking.{Miss {Holmes}went to Grammar School at 11 years. and later trained as a teacher. Returning to Christchurch in 1939, she found little change. Liverpool evacuees joined the school in 1940. Often alarmed at the sight of cows, they disliked the rural life.{Miss {Holmes,}now retired, continues to lead a busy life.
